phaseGroups.description: * Front-line health workers

* Persons ages ≥75 years
* Front-line critical workers

regions.notes: Note, the state website has removed references to phase 1b tier 2 and phase 1C. An example of the changes are https://www.placer.ca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/49578/COVID-Vaccine-Infographic-11421.

Counties will work through the 1B tiers in the following order:

Tier 1

* Individuals 65+
* First responders
* PK-12 staff, early childhood education, child care workers

Tier 2

* Front-line essential workers (food, agriculture, distribution, and manufacturing sectors)
* Disabled individuals and care staff living in home settings

Tier 3

* Staff and individuals living in congregate settings
* Government officials/staff at state capitol

Tier 4

* Health, life, and safety inspectors

Tier 5

* Correctional facility staff and incarcerated individuals

* Health care workers 
* Long-term care facilities
* Workers critical to pandemic response continuity

regions.notes: WARNING: The Minnesota website has a very nice graphic, but it is completely outdated. They've changed who is in what phase and removed any information about what the next phases look like.
